name: Turkey-Mushroom Bread Pudding
keywords: bread, mushroom, turkey leftovers, fall, main course
recipeIngredient: 2 cups cooked turkey, cut into 1/4-inch cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots and saute until softened, about 3 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until softened, about 7 minutes. Stir in the rosemary, sage, thyme, 1 teaspoon of the salt and pepper. Stir in the turkey.
Whisk eggs in large bowl. Whisk in milk until well blended. Season with remaining salt and pepper.

Layer half of the bread cubes in the bottom of an 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish. Top with the turkey mixture and then another layer of bread cubes. Pour the milk mixture over all. Bake until the bread is nicely browned and the custard is set, about 1 hour 20 minutes.
